alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 9:48PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Yuma and north central Kit Carson Counties through 1015 PM MDT... At 948 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Bonny Reservoir, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Yuma and north central Kit Carson Counties, including the following locations... Idalia. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 203 and 229. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM MDT for northwestern Kansas.
